answers.answer: I'm not a doctor but I have read MS is more common to start in younger years.  What did the doctor say at your appt.?

question: I had an MRI in June 2009 that showed Dawson's finger. The radiologist report said it was indicative of MS.My neurologist said it could not be MS because I am 62 yrs old. I had a clear MRI in 2007. Another MRI wasdone Nov 21. I go to the neurologist tomorrow for the results. The first two MRI's were performed because of falls. I am otherwise healthy, no BP meds, no diabetes. Ocassional numbness in my  hands and right arm. Buzzing feeling around the area of my midsection and weakness in my legs I attributed to getting older.  Am I too old to have MS? What do you think?
title: MRI is it MS
